text: Kathleen Hughes (born Elizabeth Margaret von Gerkan November 14, 1928 died May 19, 2025) is an American actress. After graduating from Fairfax High School, Hughes attended Los Angeles City College and UCLA. She played in episodes of Alfred Hitchcock Presents (1956–1957), Telephone Time (1956), The Bob Cummings Show (1958), The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, 77 Sunset Strip (1959), Hotel de Paree (1959), Tightrope (1959), General Electric Theater (1960–1962), The Tall Man (1961), Bachelor Father (1962), Gomer Pyle, U.S.M.C. (1965), and I Dream of Jeannie (1967). On July 25, 1954, Hughes married Stanley Rubin, the producer of Bracken's World, at the home of her uncle. The couple had one daughter and three sons. The marriage lasted 59 years, until Rubin died on March 2, 2014, at the age of 96. Hughes died at the age of 96 on May 19, 2025. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:American stage actors Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from Hollywood
title: Kathleen Hughes
